Crimes.Dispute_Type: Dispute over unpaid loans and BCR halting repayments pending litigation outcome
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Is the Band Council's BCR decision reviewable under judicial review and does the Applicant have standing to challenge it?
Crimes.Governing_Law: Section 18.1 of the Federal Courts Act
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Loans' legality confirmed by Saskatchewan Court of Appeal; BCR pertains to internal financial management
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Application dismissed due to lack of standing and untimeliness
Crimes.Burden_of_Proof: Applicant failed to establish direct impact or public interest standing
Crimes.Legal_Rule: Judicial review applies if applicant is directly affected or has public interest standing
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Untimeliness and lack of proper notice to applicant
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Challenge to Band Council Resolution halting loan repayments
Crimes.Outcome_on_Merits: BCR not subject to judicial review as it involves private commercial matters
Crimes.Key_Evidence_Considered: Saskatchewan Court of Appeal decision confirming loan legality, INAC notification in November 2001
Crimes.Legal_Framework: Federal Courts Act, private commercial law principles
Crimes.Applicant_Challenge: Seeking judicial review of BCR, mandamus, and appointment of receiver
Crimes.Court_Result: Application dismissed, costs awarded to Respondents
Crimes.Defendant_Response: BCR relates to internal governance and ongoing litigation
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Documentary evidence, court decisions, official communications
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Judicial review, mandamus, appointment of receiver
Crimes.Remedy_Sought: Judicial review and enforcement of loan payments
Crimes.Legal_Provision: Section 18.1 of the Federal Courts Act
Crimes.Jurisdiction: Federal jurisdiction under Federal Courts Act

Crimes.Dispute_Type: Dispute over unpaid loans and a BCR directing non-payment pending litigation outcome
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Is the Band Council's BCR amenable to judicial review and does the Applicant have standing to challenge it?
Crimes.Governing_Law: Section 18.1 of the Federal Courts Act
Crimes.Procedural_Context: Judicial review application filed by Peace Hills Trust Company
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Documentary evidence, court decisions, official communications from INAC
Crimes.Legal_Provision: Section 18.1 of the Federal Courts Act
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Band Council Resolution withholding loan payments during litigation
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: BCR pertains to private commercial matters, not federal tribunal action
Crimes.Application_Error: Failure to demonstrate standing or timeliness
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Judicial review applicable only to federal boards, commissions, or tribunals
Crimes.Application_Factor: Applicant not directly affected by BCR; matter governed by private law
Crimes.Decision_Review_Issue: Amenability of BCR to judicial review
Crimes.Cause_of_Refusal: Lack of standing, untimeliness, private commercial nature of dispute
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Applicant claims lack of direct communication, but INAC informed them in November 2001
Crimes.Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: BCR is internal governance decision, not subject to federal judicial review
Crimes.Relevant_Law: Federal Courts Act, principles of administrative law
Crimes.Grounds_for_Inadmissibility: Lack of standing, matter outside federal review scope
